<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Cobra Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=1738) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=112" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=152" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 128 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

You enter a tight stance, coiled up like a lashing cobra with your hands poised as venomous fangs. While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are cobra fang unarmed attacks. These deal 1d4 poison damage; are in the [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4) group; and have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), and [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) traits.

 While in Cobra Stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves and your Fortitude DC, and you gain poison resistance equal to half your level.

<title level="2">Cobra Stance leads to...</title>
[Cobra Envenom](/Feats.aspx?ID=1747)
name: Cobra Stance
